results.title: Lifesaving
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the swimming strokes best adapted to life-saving: how to approach a swimmer in difficulties, breaking holds, carries, methods of rescuing by boat and by ring buoy, and the Schafer method of resuscitation.

results.title: Lifesaving
results.brief_description: This film, which includes a demonstration of land drill by the Southsea Police Lifeguard Corps (England), shows in detail the various methods needed for rescuing a docile person, a turbulent person, somebody really violent, and a tired but clear-headed swimmer. The sidestroke method of rescue, the surface dive necessary if the subject has sunk, and the use of artificial respiration are also demonstrated.

results.title: Lifeclimb
results.creator_credit: Stan Zundell, Pyramid Films and Stan Zundell Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary in which 64 year old Stan Zundell describes the manner in which he has faced the difficulties and challenges of aging. Shows how he continually challenges himself with rigorous physical activity, increasing his abilities as he struggles to achieve his goals.

results.title: Lifeboat
results.brief_description: A small band of men and women survive the sinking of an Allied freighter by a German U-boat, only to find themselves dependent upon a Nazi they rescue from the sea into their lifeboat. With the help of a John Steinbeck script and bravura performances from a cast that includes Tallulah Bankhead, Walter Slezak and Hume Cronyn, Hitchcock transforms the cramped confines of the lifeboat into a bigger-than-life battlefield of good and evil. “Lifeboat” is a tour de force only the Master of Suspense - Alfred Hitchcock could have created.

results.title: Life: What a Ride
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”

results.title: Life. Be in it
results.creator_credit: Victorian Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation
results.brief_description: Phillip Adams conceived and developed the “Life Be In It” advertising campaign aimed at encouraging the community to become more involved in physical activity and recreation. Includes examples of television commercials featuring characters such as Norm, the average all-round armchair sportsman.

results.title: Life will never be the same
results.creator_credit: Amanda Jurisic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘You don’t need to jump on a plane, or go to a theme park or stay at a five star hotel to experience the beautiful things in life.’ Amanda Jurisic remembers her father’s legacy : a sense of adventure and a love of travel. The values he taught her have stayed with her, and inspired her to travel the world.

results.title: Life times nine
results.creator_credit: John Watson, Pen Densham and Insight Productions (US)
results.brief_description: An anthology of nine short films, each written and directed by a student (youngest 11 - oldest 15). Each film is a commercial for life, to promote appreciation of being alive. The films in the anthology are BIRD (directed and written by Kimmie Jensen); LIFE, LIFE, LIFE (directed and written by Jordon Hale); TANK (directed and written by Paul Shapiro); GHOSTS (directed and written by Marilyn Becker); PEANUT (directed and written by Ricky Clark); CHESSMEN (directed and written by Melissa Franklin); OLD FOLKS (directed and written by Robi Blumenstein); GROWING UP (directed and written by Celia Merkur) and MUD PUDDLE (directed and written by Andrew File).
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Watson, Pen Densham and Insight Productions (US)

results.title: Life story of the paramecium
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The physical characteristics, life functions, adaptation to environment and means of reproduction of the paramecium, a one-celled animal or protozoa which performs all life functions in a single cell. Some, the volvox, live in colonies and perform special functions, making it possible for new organisms to develop and function. An understanding of the protozoa provides the basis for a better understanding of the functions of all animals.

results.title: Life story
results.creator_credit: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Joel Atkinson’s parents split up, his dad took him to Shepparton. Determined to make the most of it, Atkinson worked hard to be a good role model for his siblings.
